item.title: dbView - Overview
item.description: Overview dbView is a query and analysis tool that is intended provide a consistent environment in which to work with different types of databases. I created and maintain dbView to support my day-to-day work and for this reason dbView is continually evolving and changing as my needs change. Please see me with any questions and/or for an overview of dbView capabilities. Thanks, Steve Borcherding SQLite database library I rely heavily on SQLite (SQLite Home Page) as a versatile database engine for much of the underpinnings of dbView and my related data-related tools.

item.title: dbView - Import Delimited Text to SQlite
item.description: Importing a delimited text file into a SQLite database Open a SQLite database and run the following import command (replace example parameter values with your own values) import src_type = 'text_delimited' src_file = 'REPLACE_ME_source_text_file' src_file_field_separator = 'tab' src_file_text_qualifier = 'none' src_file_header_rows = 1 src_file_max_rows = 10 'name=value;type=value;start=value;length=value;dateformat=value;nulls=true|false;nullvalue=value' src_file_field_list = 'name=field1 ; type=int ; nulls=false' ,'name=field2 ; type=varchar(50)' ,'name=field3 ; type=datetime ; dateformat=yyyyMMdd' src_file_field_load_list = 'field1' ,'field3' src_file_null_text = 'NULL' src_file_trim_char_values = 'true' src_datetime_format = 'yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss.

item.title: dbView - Import SQL Server to SQlite
item.description: Importing SQL Server data into a SQLite database Open a SQLite database and run the following import command (replace example parameter values with your own values) import src_type = 'sqlserver' src_server = 'REPLACE_ME_SQL_ServerName_Instance' src_database = 'REPLACE_ME_SQL_Database' tgt_table = 'REPLACE_ME_target_table_name' tgt_exists_action = 'fail' select * from dbo.Table1 ; parameters type required description/notes src_type string required set to 'sqlserver' src_server string required name of source SQL Server (and instance if needed)

item.title: dbView - Import SQLite to SQlite
item.description: Importing SQLite data into a SQLite database Open a SQLite database and run the following import command (replace example parameter values with your own values) import src_type = 'sqlite' src_file = 'REPLACE_ME_SQLite_Database_File_Name' tgt_table = 'REPLACE_ME_target_table_name' tgt_exists_action = 'fail' select * from Table1 ; parameters type required description/notes src_type string required set to 'sqlite' src_file string required fully pathed name of the source SQLite database file tgt_table string required name of target table in current SQLite database into which data should be loaded tgt_exists_action string optional action to take if the specified target table already exists

item.title: dbView - Import (bulk load) SQLite to SQL Server
item.description: Importing (Bulk Load) SQLite data into a SQL Server database Open a SQL Server database and run the following import command (replace example parameter values with your own values) import src_type = 'sqlite' src_file = 'REPLACE_ME_SQLite_File_Name' tgt_table = 'dbo.REPLACE_ME_SQL_Server_Target_Table_1' tgt_load_type = 'bulk_load' tgt_truncate = 'cmg_truncate' tgt_commit_interval = 10000 select * from SQLite_Source_Table_1; Note 1 - field order, field names and field datatypes MUST match between the source query and the target table.

item.title: dbView - Exporting Data
item.description:
Exporting Data Open any supported database and run one of the following export command (replace example parameter values with your own values)
Option 1 - Exporting to Delimited Text File export tgt_type = 'text_delimited' tgt_file = 'REPLACE_ME_Target_File_Name' tgt_file_field_separator = 'tab' tgt_file_text_qualifier = 'none' tgt_datetime_format = 'yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss.fff' select * from dbo.Table1; parameters type required description/notes tgt_type string required valid values are 'text_delimited' or 'sql_script' tgt_file string required fully pathed name of the target file tgt_file_field_separator string required must be either ‘tab’ or a single character
